Functional JavaScript Snippets  by Moose

JavaScript supports first-class functions which makes a lot of functional programming easy. Also, as of ES5 JavaScript has built-in support for functional programming constructs like a .map() & .reduce() which is even more fun.

Here are some fun snippets to get the creative juices flowing.

Parse binary numbers with .reduce()

function parseBinary(str) {
  return str.split('').reduce(function(a, b) {
    return a * 2 + (b === '0' ? 0 : 1);
  }, 0);
}

parseBinary('0000') -> 0
parseBinary('0001') -> 1
parseBinary('111')  -> 7
parseBinary('1000') -> 8

Infix calculator

Without operator precedence. With .reduce() and using _.groupBy(). 

function pairs(items) {
  var result = _.groupBy(items, function(item, i) {
      return Math.floor(i / 2);
  });
  return _.values(result);
}

function calc(expression) {
  var tokens = expression.split(' ');
  var n = parseInt(tokens[0]);
  tokens = tokens.slice(1);
  return pairs(tokens).reduce(function(tot, oper) {
    if (oper[0] === '+') {
      return tot + parseInt(oper[1]);
    } else if (oper[0] === '-') {
      return tot - parseInt(oper[1]);
    } else if (oper[0] === '/') {
      return tot / parseInt(oper[1]);
    } else if (oper[0] === '*') {
      return tot * parseInt(oper[1]);
    }
  }, n);
}

calc('1 + 2 * 4 / 1 / 12 - 8') -> -7
